TermDefinition.DefinitionText: A procedure in which a sample of tissue is removed from the prostate using a thin needle that is inserted through the rectum and into the prostate. Transrectal ultrasound (TRUS) is usually used to guide the needle. The sample is examined under a microscope to see if it contains cancer.

MediaLink.alt: Transrectal biopsy; shows side view of prostate, bladder, and rectum. Also shows an ultrasound probe with a needle inserted into the rectum to remove a tissue sample from the prostate.
MediaLink.Caption: Transrectal biopsy. An ultrasound probe is inserted into the rectum to show where the tumor is. Then a needle is inserted through the rectum into the prostate to remove tissue from the prostate.
